Utterances.UttText: HPI: Gerry Cage is a 47 y/o male who complains of "chest pain" 4 days ago.
He describes feeling pressure in his chest while carrying heavy groceries to his car 4 days ago, and the pain persisted for a few minutes after he sat down.

Phrases.PhraseText: heavy groceries to his car 4 days ago,

Utterances.UttText: The pain lasted a total of 4-5 minutes.
He rates the pain at 7/10 and reports feeling short of breath for 15-20 seconds while the pain persisted.
He denies other symptoms including radiation, nausea/vomiting, vision/hearing changes, or profuse sweating.
He has had several similar episodes over the past 4 months, but these have been much less intense at 2/10 each time and were associated with exertion.

Phrases.PhraseText: several similar episodes over the past 4 months,

Utterances.UttText: Family history is significant for MI in his father at 40 years old, as well as hypertension and fatal pulmonary embolism at 60 in his mother.

Phrases.PhraseText: in his father at 40 years old,

Utterances.UttText: He reports a 20 pack-year history of cigarettes, as well as moderate alcohol use; he denies recreational drugs.
He reports minimal exercise and eating "whatever is in front of him."
Medications: chlorthalidone, lisinopril Allergies: no known allergies  Physical exam: Cardiac: normal S1/S2, no murmurs, rubs, with regular rate/rhythm.
No jugular venous distension, no carotid bruits.
Pulmonary: normal vesicular breath sounds in all anterior and posterior lung fields Extremities: normal radial/pedal pulses, no edema.

Phrases.PhraseText: normal vesicular breath sounds in all anterior

Utterances.UttText: Cage is a 47 y/o male with signs and symptoms concerning for unstable angina
